meanings.definition: The quality of being sly or cunning.
meanings.sent1: Her pawkiness in hiding the surprise party was impressive.
meanings.sent2: The cat's pawkiness in catching the mouse showed its cleverness.
meanings.sent3: With a touch of pawkiness, the fox outsmarted the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The detective's pawkiness in solving the case left everyone in awe.
meanings.sent5: The pawkiness of the raccoon as it stole the cookies was unforgettable.

meanings.sent1: His pawkiness always brought laughter to the group.
meanings.sent2: The child's pawkiness was evident in the way he played pranks on his siblings.
meanings.sent3: With a hint of pawkiness, she snuck up behind him and shouted 'Boo!'
meanings.sent4: The puppy's pawkiness brightened up the gloomy day.
meanings.sent5: The pawkiness of the monkey as it swung from branch to branch was delightful.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of seriousness or respect.
meanings.sent1: His pawkiness remark during the meeting lightened the mood.
meanings.sent2: The student's pawkiness behavior in class often led to giggles.
meanings.sent3: With a touch of pawkiness, she wore a silly hat to the formal event.
meanings.sent4: The comedian's pawkiness jokes had the audience roaring with laughter.
meanings.sent5: The pawkiness expression on his face made it hard to take him seriously.
